topic: Note‑Taking that Sticks: When Handwriting Helps and How to Type Without Losing Depth
target_audience: students deciding how to take notes and teachers setting policies

refs.content: Longhand led to better performance on conceptual questions; laptop notes contained more verbatim transcription.
Mixed replication: finds limited or inconsistent longhand advantage; suggests benefits depend on conditions.

special_instructions: Present balanced view: teach generative note‑taking (summarize, question, organize) for both paper and laptops; include templates.
